Reviews.Title: “Good value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Sugarnepsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights April 16 - 18th 2012. The hotel makes a good first impression with a nicely decorated, clean and contemporary lobby. The person that checked us in was helpful and spoke very good English - he was able to tell me about a vegan restaurant within walking distance (vegan is not that popular in Barcelona) so this was very helpful and I really liked the place. Our room was very clean and modern, bathroom was spotless and both rooms were a nice size. Room had a nice TV if you care when on vacation - there were 3 or 4 channels in English. Our room was at the front of the hotel and it was quite noisy because the hotels on a busy street so a lot of street noise and sirens etc. I should have asked if we could move to a room on the other side to see how much of a difference that made but didn't. The bed was a bit hard and either had a cover on it or was made of some sort of foam that made it noisy - whenever you turned over in bed it made a crunching sort of noise that woke me up quite a bit. We booked with breakfast included and it was very good with lots of variety and they were good about refilling dishes even if you went down to breakfast on the later end. My only complaint was that they said soy milk was available if requested but every morning they said they didn't have any which was disappointing. The location is great for the metro and is only 10 min walk to Las Ramblas, very convenient location. We arrived a couple of hours early and our room wasn't available but we were able to leave our bags with the concierge and they have a safe as well so it worked out very well. Getting to the hotel from the airport was pretty straight forward by train and the metro and a lot cheaper than getting a taxi. Pick pockets and theft is a big problem in Barcelona which I didn't realize before our trip - the hotel has info posted on this and tips to safe guard and we didn't have any problems. It's a very interesting and lovely city - great place to visit. I did quite a bit of research on line before booking, reading reviews and looking at prices and I thought this hotel was a good middle of the road choice and after our stay was happy with how it turned out, good solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “This is budget but ok”
Reviews.Author: dorsetpotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is budget end of the market, but it is ok, good location, nice helpful staff.Walls a bit thin, but we did have loud neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marion v
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 19- 23 january. It is an cosy hotel and it felt like home. The staff was really friendly and give us a lot of information and a nice chat. We always felt safe and there was an familiar atmosphere. When you go outside you always had to leave your key at the reception desk, so that they could check who is run in to the hotel. The room was good and it was very clean and with new funiture (such as tv). At the hall there was an computer where you can go on the internet for free and in all peace. From the airport its easy to reach because the train station is in front the hotel. I will recommend this hotel to anyone! Enjoy your stay! Greats the dutch girls!

Reviews.Title: “Not great.....but not bad”
Reviews.Author: pdmike312
Reviews.Content: Well, I was expecting a little better considering it is listed as a four star hotel. Realistically, this is a 3 star hotel in a somewhat questionable area. Pros - The value is decent. I only paid 120 dollars a night and that's a fair price. The staff is helpful. I requested their assistance on a few things and they did the best that they could. The rooms are not bad. I wasn't "wowed" by any means, but not upset about the size of the room or amenities. I will say that my room was facing the road and it is loud at all hours of the night. Cons - This isn't the best part of Barcelona. Yes, it is located near many things.....but you are going to pass the pimps, hookers, drug dealers and really strange people that seem awkwardly standing around for no reason to get to your destination. Pedantic as it may be, the smoke detectors have two flashing lights which is quite annoying. As you are trying to adjust to the time zone change, these flashing lights make it really difficult to fall asleep. It's not major if you sleep on your stomach. Conclusion - If you book the hotel knowing that this is really a three star hotel in a not so glamorous part of town, then you won't be really let down when you get here. Knowing what I know now, I would book the hotel in a slightly better location with direct access to the La Rambla shopping area. It seems like we were constantly on that street for food and to get to all of the Gaudi stuff, as well as the Picasso museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stivonovich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, quiet and very secure. The employees are extremely helpful and very professional. The room was larger than we expected and classy in appearance. The only thing I would suggest is that they provide 220-volt to110-volt adapters for the North Americans that arrive not knowing that Europe runs on 220 volts. We could not charge our camera, I-pod and computer batteries while we were there. The pool is small but clean and there is enough area to catch some rays on the roof by the pool. The hotel restaurant is expensive but there are so many options to eat at a reasonable price around the hotel it’s not a problem. You should be aware that the prices posted at the restaurants around the hotel are for inside dining; patio dining is 10% more. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay right in dowtown Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ditzy41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one level above a hostel. We pcked it because it's cheap and within easy walking distance of downtown Barcelona. Rooms are small and shabby but very clean, with an upgraded 4-piece bathroom ensuite. The entrance is on the second floor and accessed by a buzzer at street level. The street is somewhat noisy but we quickly got used to it. Nice, friendly staff, and very private.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location to Las Ramblas and marina/pier.”
Reviews.Author: kmciintyre
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, very clean and helpful staff. Excellent location to Las Ramblas, marina/pier. Good restaurants nearby, banking, grocery store. Nice dining room and breakfast selection and hard working staff for quick turnover of diners.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Location!”
Reviews.Author: jamilas
Reviews.Content: The hotel perfectly located - very close to La Rambla, many good restaurants, Gaudi's and more! The rooms were very clean, though small. The staff was friendly and helpful. The building had good security - there was an exterior door and guests entered into the hotel rooms via the hotel office. The one warning is that the walls were paper thin and you could hear everything through the walls. I recommend ear-plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation in good location”
Reviews.Author: Portishead
Reviews.Content: Firstly there is some confusion in previous reviews as this hotel is a 1 star near to Passeig de Gracia and there is a similar named 4 star hotel in another part of Barcelona near Parel.lal. This is a budget hotel (hostel) which is accessed by a door to the left of a Bank and the rooms are on the second floor where there is a small hotel reception. I travelled with 2 friends and stayed in a triple room which was a bit small for 3 adults but it was clean and beds were made each day. There are no other facilities and definitely no rooftop pool. The location is very good, being about 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and very near to Passaig de Gracia which is an upmarket shopping area. If you are travelling from the airport I would suggest you get the airport train (0.80 euros if you buy a T10 card) as it stops immediately next to the hotel. Staff were friendly and the room had a safe which you could use for a refundable deposit of 10 euros. Barcelona was lovely although there is the ever present threat of pickpockets - we saw 2 women have bags taken whilst we were there although we were are very careful and had no problems ourselves. We went to watch Barcelona which was great and tickets are easy to get unless it is a really big game. Overall this is a reasonable, cheap option for a group of lads, although I think the wife would have wanted somewhere more upmarket!

Reviews.Title: “Many of these reviews are about a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vermilion
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed here with my daughter. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and spoke english. The location is very good being right near the Passeig de Gracia Metro stop. It is also very near the Casa Batllo/Gaudi house. It is also a good central location for both La Rambla and the Eixample sites. This is a good no frills basic hotel. The biggest problem for us was the noise. The walls and halls not only don't suppress the noise, they seem to amplify it. (I know thats' impossible) Doors opening/closing and footsteps on the bare/loose wood floors sound like gunshots when you are trying to sleep. Loud talking neighbors returning late at night from the bars sound like they are in your room. Overall it was about what we expected for 65 Euros a night. The main thing I want to say is that many of the reviews here are for a different hotel. All the reviews that talk about rooftop pools, exercise rooms, and how close they are to the Paral-lel Metro stop are talking about a different, more expensive hotel. That one is confusingly called the Hotel Universal. (not city) If you base your decision on those reviews you will be in for a big surprise.

Reviews.Title: “WORST STAFF EVER”
Reviews.Author: meyva
Reviews.Content: The place is full of egotistical jerks. not only the receptionist unprofessionally yelled at me for 30 minutes, he also said such ridiculous things, word for word, "I'M THE RULE, I'M THE DOCUMENT?!!? etc." anyways. they messed up our reservation and didnt agree to give us our 60 euro refund even if we didnt stay there AT ALL. They tried to blame the booking company for not being able to give us a refund, but when I found out that actually the booking site didnt have any say whether to give the refund, they just simply said they can't. The receptionist said the "hotel owner" is available between only 9 am to 1 pm" when i heard him talking to the owner 30 mins ago!!! - COME ON, STOP THE BULLS---T!

Reviews.Title: “happy we stayed here...friendly n very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Rajnidhie
Reviews.Content: we stayed for almost 3 nights...best location...la rambla is 10 mins by walk, metro station is only few mins by walk which is very convenient ,hotel staff is very helpfull..they are always available wen evr u need..you have to be bit carefull about ur things in barcelona...so it's better used locker service in hotel which is in room and it is free to use and very safe...we had a lovely stay in barcelona....

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: 100c0untries
Reviews.Content: It is noisy and is dirty. Besides, on bed-clothes there were blood traces. Never will not stop any more in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location, with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DaithiCorcaigh
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Monday night and were greeted by Carlos on reception who was really helpful to us. I had e-mailed the hotel before I left to ask about whats the best way to get from the airport to the hotel, and Carlos sent me a e-mail with all the options along with price, and approx time etc. The rooms were really nice and comfortable, plenty of space, lovely bathroom, air conditioned room, nice view of the main street, fridge, TV, radio etc very modern. The hotel is in a great location, only 10 min walk to Port Vell, same to La Rambla, if you go the other direction it's only about 15 min walk to Plaze de Espanya, which is where we got off when we got the aero bus from the airport, only 2 stops on the metro to the hotel, there is a metro station by the hotel. The huge plus with this hotel is there is a sun bathing area, pool, gym on the rooftop of the hotel, over looking the city, with all the main sights on view, lovely way to relax and chill out. The staff are all really nice and helpful, lovely man on the front door who always has a smile and greeting for us when we went in and out of the hotel. For the price we paid it was a fantastic stay. If you want more information dont hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at a brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: bp83
Reviews.Content: I booked a week at this hotel with my partner after looking for a package deal of flights and hotel via expedia. I had read the previous reviews of the hotel on Trip Advisor prior to booking so I had an idea that the hotel would be reasonable for the price. We arrived at the hotel later than expected and were greeted at reception by a man who was clearly very busy, but remained helpful. We were checked in to room 907 on the top floor. When we arrived at the room we were astounded to realise that we had been given the 'skyline suite' - the best accommodation in the hotel! The suite was spacious, airy, well decorated/furnished and scrupulously clean - comprising of a dining area, secondary bathroom, sitting room, external balcony , en suite bathroom and bedroom. See photographs. The suite was lined on the external side with french windows looking out on a fantastic view over the city. The doors led out onto the balcony which was equipped with table and chairs and sunloungers. Back inside, the main bedroom area was well presented with a good mini bar, large flat screen TV and lots of storage. The bedroom and lounge areas had independent air conditioning, TV's, sound systems and lighting. A large wooden sliding door separated the two areas. The master en-suite bathroom had a walk in shower and a jacuzzi bath. The jacuzzi bath sadly didn't work, but we didn't complain just in case the allocation of the suite to us had been a mistake that could have been spotted if we complained! Separate sinks and personal care kits for each person in the room are nice touches, as were the plentiful towels and dressing gowns. The rest of the experience in the hotel was also really good. The lobby areas immediately outside our room were furnished with lots of seats, and PC's for internet access. Free wireless and cable broadband is available throughout the hotel, although it is very slow. Access is faster via the provided computers in the lobby areas. We didn't book breakfast with the room but decided to add it for the first morning after our arrival. The food was served in a buffet style and was fairly typical for a mid price European hotel. We decided not to use the facility again, as better breakfast options are available for less money in the street cafes just outside of the hotel. There is a small rooftop pool and fitness area. We visited this area but didn't use it (simply because it was too hot to do so). It was well presented and maintained and there was a further cafe bar available during opening hours of the roof area. The main reception staff were always able to help us with any queries that we had, and spoke very good English. There are more computers available to use for internet access in the reception lounge area, along with a bar that we didn't visit. Regardless of what time of day we left the hotel (sometimes as late as 2 PM) we returned to find that the room had been serviced. The toiletries/personal care kit was always full and towels replaced. Several other reviewers had commented that staff had directed them to the alleyway adjacent to the hotel in order to reach the Ramblas, and that this was an unsafe area. We walked along this route on several occasions, and whilst I can understand that at night it might not be as safe as using main roads or the metro, the road was busy during the daytime and felt perfectly safe. The hotel is immediately adjacent to a metro station, Parralel. The station also houses the terminus for the funicular railway to Montijuic. Access to the very centre of the city on foot takes about 15 minutes and less by metro. The road itself leads directly to the extreme end of Port Vell and the many attractions on the seafront. We had an absolutely fantastic time in Barcelona, and as a city break within Europe it has to be one for the top ten destinations. There is a huge choice of things to do within a compact and well organised centre. The city is not cheap and entry to nearly all museums and attractions attracts a fee. Food is available for all tastes and budgets, and there is a fantastic selection of wines available. I can't recommend this a place to visit enough. Overall our view of the hotel was obviously influenced fairly heavily by us being lucky enough to get the suite accommodation. That aside, the rest of the hotel was also very good and the staff excellent. I saw inside the other rooms during our stay and would happily return staying in a standard room. I would highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a mid-budget place to stay that's somewhere between a five-start and a travel inn/holiday inn format. During our stay we went out for the evening with some of our friends who were native to Barcelona. They visited our room prior to going out and were very impressed with the hotel, much to our amusement. Interestingly they commented that the group who owned the hotel were better known for being builders of major public buildings in Spain, and had only recently branched out into hotel operations - so far so good!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised for such a good value”
Reviews.Author: garden_m0m
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this hotel for 2 rooms for 6 days, and I was concerned that maybe it wasn't in such a great section. But we had a terrific stay there. The rooms were large and modern and clean. The wireless internet worked well in our rooms & in the lobby. We enjoyed the small pool on the roof. There was OK food right on the block, but it's not a fancy neighborhood. There are 2 metro lines right outside the door of the hotel which whisked us to everywhere we wanted to go. We even took the airport bus to Placa Espania and the metro to the hotel. We had never been to Barcelona before & speak limited Spanish, but this was all pretty easy to figure out. If you're on the street side of the building, there will be a little noise in your room at night. We were on the 7th floor & at first our window wouldn't quite close all the way, but they fixed it & that helped. The streets on the 5 - 10 minute walk to the Ramblas are a little grubby & there's some ethnic mix to the people, but we never had any problems & never felt in danger. We even walked back one night after 12 when the metro had closed - our girls walked 1/2 a block ahead of us & were only approached by people handing out fliers for bars. We're from NYC & we kept our eyes open, but it was fine. It was nice to be able to stop in a supermarket up the block & get some snacks. We found the people at the hotel very helpful. We got in at about 10 & couldn't check in until 3, but they held our bags & were very charming. I guess we could have used the locker rooms by the pool if we had been eager to shower or change. The only reason I don't give this hotel a perfect score is that I didn't find it extraordinary in any way. It was everything we needed, but I don't want to oversell it as anything that's a special destination or luxury experience. Oh - and so wonderful to find a truly non-smoking oasis in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with choice of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: whittakerclan
Reviews.Content: this was out first trip to Barcelona for a 2 night break.The Hotel is very clean and the reception area has free internet service. The rooms are lovely very formal but with a good sized bathroom which was immaculate, the window has frosted glass and would not open very far so there was no view but we did not have any trouble with noise. Air con was great as it was roasting outside. The pool on the 10 th floor roof is a 'god send' with a lovely decked area and comfy hammock chairs there is also a pool bar service which is billed to your room and free towels so its really convenient. After exploring it is great to chill up there and was never busy. The location was typical for inner city on a busy road, there are plenty of local bars serving drinks and tapas and everyone was really welcoming. It became a bit dodgy further down the road but if you keep on the main road its easy to walk down to the marina and cut through to Las Ramblas takes about 15 mins. Be careful cutting down any side streets at night .i will say that there is plenty of police presence around which i found reassuring in abusy bustling city. The centre is wonderful with lots of places to see and eat at. We did walk to the beach which takes about 45 mins but is worth the treck as its a great city beach with great atmosphere and the harbour is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel - not very friendly though”
Reviews.Author: SkinnyNottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week, which is longer than we would normally but the flights were so cheap we couldn’t resist, we love Barcelona! The hotel is in an excellent location for sight seeing, a quick walk to the Rambles and Port Vell and a metro stop is right outside. Take the main roads to walk to the Rambles as the short cut isn’t that short and also goes through some very “interesting” areas that may be unsafe after the throngs of tourists have died down in the early hours, the road way is quick and easy to remember! The hotel is modern and clean, although not a 4 star – more of a good 3 star. The roof top pool is small but has amazing views all over Barcelona and is very well kept and presented, we liked it for a quick drip after a day out before going for dinner. We were on a late flight home and utilised the pool area on the last day as there is a shower room up there too! Hotel does have clinical feel but what you lose in “the personal touch” you make up for in convenient location. The staff do not go out of their way to make you feel welcome and the men on reception in the evening were abrupt to the point of rudeness with everyone, even arguing with a poor lady who was requesting some baby food to be heated. The day receptionists seemed very nice…maybe they just didn’t like their shift pattern. The hotel did mess up our room booking and gave us a twin for the first night but moved us and our belongings the second night, a bottle of wine or something to say sorry would have been nice but as I said, it isn’t that sort of hotel. Take ear plugs and a room on the front of the hotel, the rooms to the back of the hotel open the windows into a service shaft so you have no view outside at all. I’d rather have a view of the hustle and bustle and ear plugs than be in a cave! We never ate in the hotel as it seems a waste when in such a beautiful city, there is a lovely Japanese restaurant a few doors down which we loved and breakfast is easy and cheap to find almost anywhere; Barcelona is great for eating and drinking! Watch your wallet, we have been to Barcelona 6 times now and are both well travelled but this time was the first time we got pick pocketed. It was right outside the hotel when we had our cases, it’s a real pain, so be careful. We had had an attempted robbery earlier in the week too. There seems to be a crime wave in Barca at the moment so get a good card insurer, don’t carry too much on you, use the safe at the hotel and watch where you put your credit cards etc…they are watching you! It is a wonderful city though and we’d go back tomorrow (or once all our replacement cards arrive!) and this hotel is ideally located to explore it all.

Reviews.Title: “Still decent value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SunderlandMackem
Reviews.Content: The Universal came up trumps when we booked an un-named 4-star hotel through an internet agency. We paid. £67 per room per night which, in these difficult times, was very good value. Reception staff were very pleasant, and I e-mailed beforehand a request for a rear room on a high floor, which was acknowledged and fulfilled. The room was fine, not enormous, though the bed was! Spotlessly clean, I cannot think how there could be any complaints here. The restaurant offered a good value dinner for 19 euros - a good first course buffet, choice of main course, and help yourself to pud. However I doubt if many room-only visitors will take the breakfast at 14.98 euros. Everywhere else seems to offer coffee and a croissant for 1.50 euros. The rooftop pool was closed whilst we wewre there (it was raining anyway), but was nice, with deck chairs and good views. Adjacent was a gym with up-to-date equipment. Barcelona seems to have got it's act together over the last few years with a much heavier - and reassuring - presence of police and security people. The metro and main tourist areas feel a lot safer, though that doesn't mean you don't take sensible precautions. This hotel, providing you book early on the internet, is very good. Handy for the port, Montjuic hill (funicular leaves Paral-lel metro station literally outside the front of the hotel), and everywhere of interest is walkable. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “good for holiday and better for business”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for us - Although i was on a holiday with my wife this would be better for a business traveller. the room we were in was very large. big window - granted over looking busy street but still daylight if you need it. there is pool and roof top deck for sunsets and drink on a patio. if you can get a room on the 9th floor you get your own patio (don't know the rate) A very very good breakfast spread. very good assortment along with the usual bread and cheese affair. the location of this hotel at first glance seems off - however it is close enough to all the major sights and locations (the Las Ramblas for instance) without being right on these tourist locations and having the more expensive rate. If you like a little walking this is great location and great hotel and a better value than a lot of the other tourist places. All the staff we came into contact with were friendly and spoke english. We didn't find this hotel in any of the the common travel help guide books and it is a shame and injustice. it fits right in and would of value to any traveller. not cute and cozy and looks more german than spanish but a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kennsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a work colleague even after considering it before hand. Great location directly above a metro station and 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas and the harbour. We were originally checked into a smoking room on a lower floor facing the main road even though a request was placed for a non-smoking room. Fortunately, they moved us to an upper floor the next day with minimum fuss which had great views across the city. The hotel did have a corporate feel and was generally clean. Extras included a small pool on the roof and free internet access. The reception staff were always smiling and generally very helpful with all questions.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Hotel Universal and top tip!”
Reviews.Author: SJP_8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights in Barcelona staying at Hotel Universal. I always use this site and thought it was about time I contributed!. Hotel is 4 star, very corporate I think it may be more a buisness hotel. If you prefer character I would suggest it's not for you, but I personally liked it. Very clean, small rooftop pool ( must go up to the roof fab views of the city) a short walk from Metro (Paral-el on line 3.) And a stroll to the Ramblas. Breakfast is buffet style and worth having to set you up for the day (I think it added about £25 to our 3 nigt stay which I think is worth it.) A number of staff speak english. The only down side for me was the beds- not the most comfortable and only 1 pillow!, that said with all the walking I still slept soundly. Top tips for Barceloan include: get the local bus form the airport into the city, it's cheap and runs form out front going to both Plaza Espanya ( can get onto the metro there for this hotel) and Plaza Catalunya ( which is right in the centre.) Dont go to MontJuic park on Sunday!, unless you are prepared to que. We went to go on the cable car and turned round as the que was so huge, even this early in the year, went back Monday and walked straight on!. Finally do the Bus tour (Barcelona Bus Turistica) there are 3 routs covering the whole city, 20 euro's for a one day ticket I relaly cant recommend it enough, saves the feet and you gte to see everything and then can then re visit the things you relaly want to see. In the evenings we found good nightlife at Port Olympic ( the site of the 92 games) whcih has been re developed and has some great restaurants and bars as well as great becah side views.

Reviews.Title: “A nasty place. Only masochists and desperate people should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: blackpoolrock
Reviews.Content: Fortune favours the brave ... The Hotel Universal in Barcelona favours the gullible. A long review, but this is what Laurence Lewellen-Hairdo never tells you on the Travel Programme. My partner and myself spent a week at a fantastic resort hotel near Salou (The hotel Estival. Stay there. Its ace). I thought it was a good idea to travel to Barcelona and stay the night (and next day) in a supposedly enchanting city before flying back to the UK. Let me explain. I had been nagging for almost 2 years for us to take a holiday together so my hopes were fairly high, especially looking at the Universal's website and descriptions. But oh what a major disappointment would be waiting for us. Yes it is now cheap to fly into Barcelona since everywhere is rapidly becoming 'Ryanised' (Ryan Air are advancing faster than a Starbucks cafe opening programme). And that my friends is exactly what Barcelona is.... cheap. Not financially because it is unbelievably pricey in the cafes, shops and so on. Even the market stalls seem to cost more than a BUPA hip operation. Cheap because of the dirt, smells, traffic smog and the general low life people you find in the district surrounding The Universal Hotel. The room was fairly contemporary but resembled a zoo on our arrival due to all the people in the very small lobby. I had emailed them in advance asking for a 'quiet room' having read reviews about how noisy this hotel was supposed to be. I repeat again, 'a quiet room'. However, because it said we were arriving two hours later than our actual arrival, they wouldn't let us have our room, although the clerk told me it had been cleaned and made up. There was no logical explanation for this room denial obsession other than 'its not allowed'. When we eventually gained access to our promised pleasure dome ( they told us they had given us a really quiet room and one of the finer ones), we found a contemporary attempt at decor - basically everywhere was MDF'd half to death and coloured brown. The beds would have suited Grumpy, Sleepy, Doc and the other dwarves. They were tiny and resembled camping beds. The bathroom was lovely I have to say, with the best little pack of freebie toiletries I've seen for a while. Although I had to go to reception to obtain another pack as there were two of us. As for the language, at first the staff spoke good English until that is, anything critical was mentioned about the hotel or its service. Then they would simply pretend not to understand. Neither would they converse in Spanish - whether a diversion tactic or simply because this part of Spain (Catalunya) have their own 'language' much different to mainstream Spanish and they simply refuse to speak it. Everywhere slogans and grafiti declared 'Catalunya is not Spain' as they seek their independence. For me, they can have it and one of the best things to do is to build a large Berlin-esque wall around the place. The district where the Universal is located is so grubby, its like being in a third world tin-pot country somewhere. About 100 yards along the street and you see more tramps and vagrants, drunks and hobos than I have ever seen in one place anywhere. Every empty doorway seemed occupied by them. The food choices are pretty diabolical although I can reccomend a lebanese owned cafe which is near the hotel despite its unbelievably garish orange plastic interior. You wanna see what prostitutes actually do in their spare time? then there is a treat in store for you if you choose to stay at The Universal. I was sat having coffee at The Lebanese place (outside) and from nowhere, 4 hookers started arguing and shouting. Then the pimp turned up, slapped two of them around and then another 11 prostitutes turned up and it was like WW III. Fighting, scrapping, throwing each other into the road and onto my table. The area is one of the seediest and dirty places I have ever seen, and I've been to Hong Kong, Bankok and New York. This district takes the proverbial biscuit. Watch out also for the dozens of the most twisted, deformed dwarfs and disabled people you've ever seen in your life begging on the street corners. Children will be terrified by some of the deformities. I know I was. It was like having your own private Ripley's Believe it or Not freak show on the doorstep of the hotel. Turning back to the hotel and our 'fine quiet room'. it was the noisiest room I have ever stayed in. it was right opposite the lift which sounded all night as though a truck was driving up and down the hallway. I asked for a transfer and was told 'is not possible. Is not allowed' and they claimed to be full. However, he said there was no one to clean the room. That's when the convenient forgetting of English and Spanish kicked in. The noise from the neighbouring rooms was dreadful. everytime anyone went to the toilet, you could hear every single trickle, grunt and otherwise because the walls were so paper thin. The noise of people coming and going, snoring and even love-making made a night's decent sleep virtually impossible.I was rather put out that my own desire for romantic city passions were crushed "In case anyone hears". Thank you paper thin walls! The next morning, breakfast was a very unpleasant experience. We had to mill around completely ignored by the two waiting staff. eventually we sat ourselves to the only vacant table which was littered with the remains of earlier breakfast and stained with spilled coffee. The cutlery was dirty, the plates were dirty and cracked (and I mean really cracked), some with chips out of them and even the cups were dirty.This was lots of the cutlery/ crockery not just an isolated few.Breakfast was reasonable but no way was it a sumptious buffet. The dining room was about the size of the living room of an average semi detached house lounge. As far as the hotel is concerned, forget about complaining, as they simply do not wish to know. They have a complaint form to fill in which I was told "are not read by anyone or acted upon". The gym is basically a small room with 4 exercise bikes in it and the pool is only open from May to September. The views from the roof are basically like looking at a Gypsey shanty town, which is precisely what surrounds the hotel. See attached photos. A lovely sight if you look out of your hotel room windows. There is a saying that you get what you pay for. Although this hotel was through lastminute.com as a 'secret hotel' (four star or above who dont want to reveal their name), I can understand why if you know where it is and the service you receive there. At most I would only give this place a 2 star rating. My advice is to save your money and book elsewhere. This hotel is a complete waste of money and effort. Disappointment, noise, grime, poor service, tiny beds, drunken hen parties peeing openly in the street, prostitute fights, vagabonds and constant emergency vehicle sirens all day and night are the only things that await you. Add this to the constant loud construction noise and the screaming and loud music and dogs barking from the slum housing surrounding the hotel, and I think you should be booking elsewhere in a hurry. This hotel is a place to be avoided like the plague, at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Rooms with no windows!”
Reviews.Author: Gill56
Reviews.Content: In a group of 20 we visited this hotel for a business for 3 days. The hotel is situated on a busy road with a lot of sirens through the night - v. noisy. I had a room with a window that overlooked a covered store room area of the hotel. I like natural light in a room which I definitely didn't have. Some of the group also commented that they didn't have any windows! A tiny bar area which appeared to open and close when it pleased the staff. Staff not very friendly. Location not bad although beside the red light district

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ghanno
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a convenient area, near Las Ramblas and there is a metro stop right outside. It is not, however, near the shopping district but everything is in close walking distance of about 20 - 30 minutes and there are also quite a few metro stations around. The reception staff speak English quite well and were good with booking. Check-in was fast. The room was comfortable and a relatively good size. The bathroom is nice and was always kept clean - supplied with bath sponge, shaving kit, dental kit, comb, soap, shampoo and bath gel as well as a shoe shine sponge. The only downside was the noise which came from the street at night and in the early morning as well as noise which travelled from the hallways when guests came in and out. It doesn't seem as if the hotel is extensively sound-proofed. The breakfast buffet was sumptuous, offering an extensive and well-catered selection of food for breakfast from 7am - 11am. The gym is quite small and a small pool on the roof that isn't heated but they do supply free bottles of water. If you speak German, you're in for a real treat - over 70% of the TV channels in this hotel are for German speakers, with one channel for English speakers - Sky News. In general, the hotel is well-maintained, clean and the housekeeping staff were very efficient and all staff in general were very accommodating for English speakers and those who can speak a bit of Spanish. We would come back to this hotel because its good location and economic cost of room for the services rendered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice in bits!”
Reviews.Author: sammywammy
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the best hotel I'd been to, neither was it the worst. The rooftop pool was great for a cool down but it was a bit nippy. The buffet breakfast was also recommendable, but the staff were a little impolite. The area was close to Las Ramblas and the Barri Gottic, but you had to walk down streets with a lot of peep shows to get there. The room was well equipt, but we looked out into the backs of other flats, and one man there was a big fan of Bob Marley. It's not that we don't like Bob Marley, but we could here him singing along at 10 o' clock at night. There also was a very useful business room with free internet but I think next time I'd choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Redtrail
Reviews.Content: We got dumped by our 'reserved' B&B and were thankful to find anything available during the Formula 1 weekend. We stayed 3 nights. The accomodation was basic but acceptable for what it was. Reasonably clean. Felt fairly secure. Very noisy from the street. Great central location. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I gave it 3 stars because you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Abuse by receptionist Umberto”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in I was OK with the fact that a cheap 1* hotel did not have the welcome allure of more stars but the welcome was ok. In the room, the bed was 1.80m long, which is not enough for any client. Everything went quite alright until I got to use the phone. The acting receptionist was not only rude to my correspondent but subsequently was very abusive to me. The phrase "This is not your country" on my comment that I felt it inappropriate to address guests like that on a simple issue of phone usage blew my fuses. I have directly left and will make sure never to reserve there anymore. The point seemed to be that this hotel has ONE phoneline, which I obviously used for my business usage... I feel it completely unprofessional for a hotel in which you pay 65euros per night, without breakfast, to not have a decent phone central. Outgoing calls were completely impossible too. Suggestion: Check hotel on La rambla, better location, very nice rooms, decent and professional service and the price; 45euros.
